Terminology

Logic Record - An "Application File" that defines application behavior, or extends platform capability with new functionality. These records are executed by platform engines, and may be both declarative (no-code/drag-n-drop) and/or programmatic (Javascript/HTML/CSS). I.e., anything with a script, a condition field for execution, conditional data manipulation, or branching logic (if, switch, while, for) that ultimately processes end user data

Config Record - An "Application File" that defines data structures and relationships, or configures existing application logic or platform capability. These records are declarative, but may contain scripts for initialization

Configuration vs Customization

  • Configuration requires no code (properties, options, role based access controls, natural language flow design, graphical workflow, data lookup, etc)
  • Customization requires code (Javascript, HTML, CSS, AngularJS, Bootstrap, etc)

You "configure" with both declarative logic records and config records. You "customize" with programatic logic records, i.e. script
